poem:
**Negotiation**

In the metal womb,  
voices rise, hammering  
at the sky's iron skin.  
Flightless their protest,  
wings clipped by want,  
the promise of uplift  
threaded in numbers.  
What is the price  
of flight and silence  
when the machine's heart  
demands its own  
rhythm, pulsing only  
to the beat of gold?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Boeing strike may end if workers agree to 35% pay raise in upcoming vote Boeing workers have tentatively scheduled a vote on a proposed labor deal that could signal the end of the strike on which they went more than a month ago, their union said on Saturday. A contract ratification vote is expected this upcoming Wednesday, 23 October, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (IAM) said in a post on X. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
